snippet: Two men were found guilty of the murder of a black teenager, Stephen Lawrence, in April 1993, a case that prompted an examination of racism in London’s police force.
abstract: British jury finds Gary Dobson and David Norris guilty of the racially motivated stabbing and murder of teenager Stephen Lawrence in south London in 1993; convictions, the first in the case, are likely to draw lengthy sentences; case has become famous as an emblem of failed justice, and of institutionalized racism at Scotland Yard.
lead_paragraph: Two men were found guilty of the murder of a black teenager, Stephen Lawrence, in April 1993, a case that prompted an examination of racism in London’s police force.

headline.main: Guilty Verdicts in 1993 Racial Murder Case That Changed Justice in Britain
headline.print_headline: Guilty Verdicts in 1993 Racial Murder Case That Changed Justice in Britain
